career-reviews:0000:
# The highest-impact career paths our research has identified so far ## !empty

Published July 2015 · Last updated March 2022
career-reviews:0004: The highest-impact career for you is the one that allows you to make the biggest contribution to solving one of [the world’s most pressing problems](https://80000hours.org/problem-profiles/). On this page, we list some broad categories of impactful careers, followed by about 30 more specific and unusual career paths we think are especially impactful, such as long-term AI policy research. The lists are based on [10 years of research](https://80000hours.org/key-ideas/#what-is-our-advice-based-on) and experience advising people, and represent the careers it seems to us will be most impactful over the long run if you get started on them now — though of course we can’t be sure what the future holds.
career-reviews:0006: You can use the lists on this page to get new ideas for impactful careers and make sure you haven’t missed a great option. Then select between them primarily [based on your fit](https://80000hours.org/articles/personal-fit/) — see our [guide on how to make a career plan](/career-planning/process) for details on how to choose. Click on the profiles to learn more about why we chose each one, how to assess your fit, and see open high-impact job opportunities.
career-reviews:0008: <div class="well visible-if-not-newsletter-subscriber margin-bottom margin-top padding-top-small padding-bottom-small">
career-reviews:0010: ## Learn how to get involved in our community.
career-reviews:0014:
- Weekly job opportunities
- Opportunities to connect with others
- Community news about high-impact careers
career-reviews:0024: <section class="wrap section-full-width bg-alternating-start-off-white padding-top-larger padding-bottom-larger"><div class="container "><div class="row"><div class="col-sm-10 col-sm-offset-1 col-md-8 col-md-offset-2 col-content">
career-reviews:0028: Before thinking about specific career paths, we think it’s valuable to consider what _kinds_ of careers tend to be highest impact. The career categories below can enable you to make a big contribution to whichever global problems you think are most pressing.
career-reviews:0030: -
career-reviews:0039: ### Government and policy in an area relevant to a top problem
career-reviews:0045: Work out how government policy can help solve the world’s most pressing problems, and help make those policies happen.
career-reviews:0057: -
career-reviews:0072: Help build great organisations doing important work via entrepreneurship, operations, people management, project management, fundraising, or administration.
career-reviews:0084: -
career-reviews:0099: Aim to make intellectual advances about how to tackle the world’s most pressing problems.
career-reviews:0111: -
career-reviews:0120: ### Applying an unusual skill to a needed niche
career-reviews:0126: We mostly focus on more common skills, but a huge variety is needed. If you already have expertise in a narrow area, there might be a way to apply it to a pressing global problem.
career-reviews:0138: -
career-reviews:0153: Convey important ideas and information in a compelling way, and you can help others focus on the right things and work more effectively.
career-reviews:0165: -
career-reviews:0180: Take a job that fits you well and lets you contribute financially to funding-constrained, highly effective organisations.
career-reviews:0197: <section class="wrap section-full-width bg-alternating-start-off-white padding-top-larger padding-bottom-larger"><div class="container "><div class="row"><div class="col-sm-10 col-sm-offset-1 col-md-8 col-md-offset-2 col-content">
career-reviews:0201: If you want to help tackle [the global problems we think are most pressing](/problem-profiles/), these are the career paths we most recommend — our **priority paths**. Most of them are difficult to enter — you may need to start by investing in building skills for several years, and there may be relatively few positions available. However, if you have the potential to excel in any of these paths, we encourage you to seriously consider it.
career-reviews:0203: We’ve ranked these paths roughly in terms of impact, assuming your personal fit for each is constant. But there is _a lot_ of variation within each path — so the best opportunities in one lower on the list will often be better than most of the opportunities in a higher-ranked one. Note we may periodically adjust this list based on changes in the opportunities for impact or updates to our views.
career-reviews:0205: -
career-reviews:0214: ### 1. AI safety technical research
career-reviews:0220: The development of AI could transform society. Help increase the chance it’s positive by tackling the technical problems of AI alignment, such as ‘corrigibility,’ ‘interpretability,’ and reliability.
career-reviews:0232: -
career-reviews:0241: ### 2. Shaping future governance of AI
career-reviews:0247: State regulation and industry governance may determine whether the deployment of AI goes well or badly. This path is currently underdeveloped, but building policy experience and expertise now may allow you to have an exceptionally high impact in the future.
career-reviews:0259: -
career-reviews:0268: ### 3. Biorisk research, strategy, and policy
career-reviews:0274: Help reduce the risk of a global biological catastrophe, like an engineered pandemic much worse than COVID-19.
career-reviews:0286: -
career-reviews:0295: ### 4. Founder of new projects tackling top problems
career-reviews:0301: Most people can only do great work within a great organisation. Make it possible to deploy more talent and resources toward progress on pressing global problems.
career-reviews:0313: -
career-reviews:0322: ### 5. Helping build the effective altruism community
career-reviews:0328: If you could cause two other, equally talented people to use their skills to tackle the world’s most pressing problems, that’d be double the impact you’d have if you did it yourself
career-reviews:0340: -
career-reviews:0349: ### 6. China-related AI safety and governance paths
career-reviews:0355: Help Chinese companies and stakeholders involved in building AI make the technology safe and good for society.
career-reviews:0367: -
career-reviews:0376: ### 7. Grantmaker focused on pressing world problems
career-reviews:0382: Allocate philanthropic funding as effectively as possible by identifying and vetting new organisations and projects.
career-reviews:0394: -
career-reviews:0403: ### 8. Operations management in high-impact organisations
career-reviews:0409: One of the biggest bottlenecks for organisations working on pressing global problems is excellent operations staff to design, scale, and implement great systems.
career-reviews:0421: -
career-reviews:0430: ### 9. Research into global priorities
career-reviews:0436: Help identify the most pressing global problems and the most effective ways to solve them to enable others to have a greater impact.
career-reviews:0448: -
career-reviews:0457: ### 10. Forecasting and related research and implementation
career-reviews:0463: Help powerful institutions make good predictions and decisions, particularly around catastrophic risks.
career-reviews:0480: <section class="wrap section-full-width bg-alternating-start-off-white padding-top-larger padding-bottom-larger"><div class="container "><div class="row"><div class="col-sm-10 col-sm-offset-1 col-md-8 col-md-offset-2 col-content">
career-reviews:0482: ## Sometimes recommended: other high-impact career paths we’re excited about
career-reviews:0484: Below we list some other career paths that we don’t recommend as often or as highly as those above, but which can still often be top options for people we advise. Take a look and consider any that might be a good fit for you. These aren’t ranked in terms of impact.
career-reviews:0488: -
career-reviews:0497: ### Historian of large societal trends, inflection points, progress, or collapse
career-reviews:0503: Help anticipate future changes to society and technology by examining the past.
career-reviews:0515: -
career-reviews:0530: Build a platform and spread important ideas about pressing global problems and how we can best solve them.
career-reviews:0545: -
career-reviews:0560: Shape the course and pace of AI deployment though AI hardware — e.g. by restricting or allowing access to compute by different actors.
career-reviews:0572: -
career-reviews:0587: Help prevent emerging technologies like AI and biotech from being misused, stolen, or tampered with.
career-reviews:0599: -
career-reviews:0608: ### Policy careers focused on other pressing global issues
career-reviews:0614: Research, promote, or implement policies that address global issues beyond biosecurity and AI safety.
career-reviews:0626: -
career-reviews:0635: ### Specialist in emerging global powers
career-reviews:0641: Help emerging global powers coordinate with the rest of the world in addressing pressing global problems.
career-reviews:0653: -
career-reviews:0662: ### Manager of a long-term philanthropic fund
career-reviews:0668: Help philanthropists invest resources now in order to deploy the returns in the medium- to long-term future, or whenever the time is right.
career-reviews:0680: -
career-reviews:0689: ### Investigate a potentially pressing but unexplored global issue
career-reviews:0695: See if we can make progress on an under-researched problem that could be even more pressing than those we currently prioritise.
career-reviews:0707: -
career-reviews:0716: ### Data collection for AI alignment
career-reviews:0722: Act like a social scientist to design and build pipelines that collect data from humans which could be useful for AI alignment.
career-reviews:0735: ### Other impactful options if you’re an especially good fit
career-reviews:0737: -
career-reviews:0752: Spread important ideas and help shape public discourse for the better.
career-reviews:0764: -
career-reviews:0773: ### Non-technical roles in leading AI labs
career-reviews:0779: You don’t have to be a technical or policy researcher to help AI labs work toward greater safety.
career-reviews:0791: -
career-reviews:0806: Use coding skills to help shape the development of AI, prevent pandemics, and support the most impactful nonprofits.
career-reviews:0818: -
career-reviews:0833: Multiply the impact of research by guiding, coordinating, and promoting the best work.
career-reviews:0845: -
career-reviews:0854: ### Organise an effective altruism local group
career-reviews:0860: Grow the effective altruism community by running events, mentoring, and connecting people to one another.
career-reviews:0872: -
career-reviews:0887: Improve government policies through targeted research and advocacy.
career-reviews:0899: -
career-reviews:0914: Get great career capital by working at a tech startup — and if it works out, have a positive impact by donating part of your earnings.
career-reviews:0926: -
career-reviews:0941: Do research in academia, which is home to some of the most far-reaching and cutting-edge research we can do.
career-reviews:0953: -
career-reviews:0962: ### Research & advocacy promoting impactful climate solutions
career-reviews:0968: Identify and implement the most effective solutions to climate change by focusing on the most extreme risks and neglected technologies.
career-reviews:0980: -
career-reviews:0989: ### Earning to give in a high-paying role, such as quantitative trading
career-reviews:0995: Get an extremely high-paying job, then donate some of your salary to the most effective charities you can find.
career-reviews:1007: -
career-reviews:1016: ### Become an executive assistant for someone doing especially high-impact work
career-reviews:1022: Know of someone doing very valuable work? Multiply their impact by taking time-consuming tasks off their plate.
career-reviews:1034: -
career-reviews:1043: ### Improving China-Western coordination on global catastrophic risks
career-reviews:1049: The broader version of our top-recommended path on shaping China’s involvement in AI: help coordinate China and the West on a variety of global issues.
career-reviews:1061: -
career-reviews:1076: Develop and deploy potential technological solutions to important problems.
career-reviews:1089: ## Steps to build career capital and increase your future impact
career-reviews:1091: These aren’t career paths per se, but they can be great phases in your career that can set you up to have an even greater impact later. This list is especially incomplete compared to the others.
career-reviews:1093: -
career-reviews:1108: Learn about policy making and government while having a direct social impact by helping improve government policies.
career-reviews:1120: -
career-reviews:1135: Get a valuable credential in a field relevant to most of our priority paths (especially global priorities research), plus set yourself up for good earning-to-give options.
career-reviews:1147: -
career-reviews:1162: Understand the cutting edge of machine learning in order to contribute to the safe deployment of AI.
career-reviews:1174: -
career-reviews:1189: Learn about founding a startup while gaining connections and a broad skillset.
career-reviews:1201: -
career-reviews:1210: ### Law school in the US
career-reviews:1216: Earn a valuable credential while developing your legal knowledge, analytical skills, and professional network.

career-reviews:1265: <section class="wrap section-full-width bg-alternating-start-off-white padding-top-larger padding-bottom-larger"><div class="container "><div class="row"><div class="col-sm-10 col-sm-offset-1 col-md-8 col-md-offset-2 col-content">
career-reviews:1267: ## How to choose which career path _you_ should pursue
career-reviews:1269: The purpose of these lists is to give you more ideas about high-impact career paths. There are likely many other options worth considering for your personal list that we don’t cover.
career-reviews:1271: As we cover in our [key ideas series](/key-ideas/), the overall impact of your career depends on **both**:
career-reviews:1273:
- How impactful the path is in general
- Your degree of [personal fit](/key-ideas/personal-fit/) with it
career-reviews:1276: So once you have some good ideas, we recommend you narrow down based on fit — including whether the path is likely to be sustainable and personally satisfying.
career-reviews:1278: To help you work out which career path is best for you, we’ve created [an eight-week planning course](https://80000hours.org/career-planning/process/) to help you systematically think through important factors in choosing a career, generate more ideas, and identify your best option. (After that, check out our [job board](/job-board/) for opportunities in the career path that fits you best.)
career-reviews:1286: <section class="wrap section-full-width bg-alternating-start-off-white padding-top-larger padding-bottom-larger"><div class="container "><div class="row"><div class="col-sm-10 col-sm-offset-1 col-md-8 col-md-offset-2 col-content"><div class="tw--mt-6 tw--p-3 tw--pt-2 tw--bg-gray-lighter tw--rounded-md ">
career-reviews:1288: ### Read next:  Personal fit: why being good at your job is even more important than people think
career-reviews:1290: [!img~ width="720" height="448" ~[Decorative post preview](https://80000hours.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/simone-biles-720x448.jpeg)](https://80000hours.org/articles/personal-fit/)
career-reviews:1296: People’s productivity varies greatly, so personal fit is one of the most important factors in determining the expected impact of your career.
career-reviews:1304: <div class="well bg-gray-lighter margin-bottom margin-top padding-top-small padding-bottom-small">
career-reviews:1306: ### Enter your email and we’ll mail you a book (for free)
career-reviews:1308: We believe you can help tackle some of the world’s biggest and most neglected problems, and our only aim is to help you do that.
career-reviews:1310: Join our newsletter and we’ll send you a free copy of _The Precipice_ — a book by philosopher Toby Ord about how to tackle the greatest threats facing humanity.
